passages.text:
Welcome to the Trellis example story!

This example will walk through the features of the game engine.

[[Let's get started!|Choices]]
passages.name: Welcome to Trellis

passages.text:
The Trellis engine helps make interactive fiction work. 

Interactive fiction requires choices, right?

[[Right.|Choice 1]]
[[I guess.|Choice 2]]
passages.name: Choices

passages.text:
Exactly!

And each choice can matter, leading virtually anywhere.

[[Wow|Macros]]
passages.name: Choice 1

passages.text:
Of course, wrong choices can lead seemingly anywhere.

[[I'll be careful|Macros]]
passages.name: Choice 2

passages.text:
Trellis supports several macros. Macros are handled in the order they come in.

Select a macro to begin:
[[Display]]
[[Sleep]]
[[Wait]]
[[Custom]]

[[Exit]]
passages.name: Macros

passages.text:
The sleep macro is used to<sleep 1000> well...<sleep 1000> sleep.

[[Go back|Macros]]
passages.name: Sleep

passages.text:
The wait macro waits until the engine is told to continue. This could be a mouse click or the traditional
<wait>

[[Go back|Macros]]
passages.name: Wait

passages.text:
Display is the default macro. Display is used to render text.

No special syntax is associated with it.

[[Go back|Macros]]
passages.name: Display

passages.text:
Custom macros provide the most versitality. Make text jiggle, trigger an event, or <type 50 "type out text.">

[[Go back|Macros]]
passages.name: Custom

passages.text:
Thank you for trying out the Trellis example game!
<sleep 2000>
<exit>
passages.name: Exit
